title: Logos with letters and numbers
content:
Are there any well designed logos that combine letters and numbers? None come to mind when I think of it.

I have to develop a simple logo with ’MI225’. I can’t help but think of the periodic table, but that’s not what I want to accomplish.

 [‹ Some issues concerning an Arabic dictionary](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/typophile.com/node/39520 "Go to previous forum topic") [Favorite magazine masthead (logo-type) Battle Royal ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/typophile.com/node/27504 "Go to next forum topic")
author: coupdegrace

comments.content:
The band U2 has never really had a “logo” now that I think of, unless its what . . . Helvetica bold? I don’t know but you should probably go ahead and buy these:

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100018](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100018 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100018")

I would. ;)

[\_1](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/8808)

[\_2](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/5543)

[\_3](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/2953)

[\_4](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/1551)

[\_5](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720133635/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/6726)

All of these use different methods of incorporating type and numbers: Roman numerals, creating the counter space of the type with numbers, pixel accentuation, etc.
Or are you talking about using numbers within a word like the film se7en?
